title: How were the Nazca line drawings, recently of a cat, made if nobody guided them flying from above? What's the secret? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not that much of a secret. We know how they were made and researchers have even come up with a compelling & logical explanation for why they were made, if not for why they were made to look like they do, but no matter the explanations, they are still a truly magnificent achievement. How the Nazca Lines were made | Blog Machu Travel Peru They were created by removing rocks and earth to reveal the lighter underlying rock below and they’ve lasted so long because the climate is so dry. Scientists believe the lines were made by the Nazca people, around AD 10 to 700. It’s thought they must have used rope grids and stakes to outline each of the drawings and keep them accurate and to scale and though it seems as if they can only be seen from the air, they actually can be seen from higher elevations around them.
